diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The patient presented with acute-onset right lower quadrant (RLQ) abdominal pain along with nausea and anorexia. Physical examination revealed focal tenderness at McBurney's point in the RLQ. CT scan of the abdomen and pelvis indicated a dilated fluid-filled appendix with mucosal hyperenhancement and periappendiceal fat stranding, consistent with acute appendicitis.
